title: 13 Best Gifts for Dad He’ll Actually Want in 2025
description: Decor, appliances, and gear that will make 2025 his best year yet
author: Blake Bakkila
excerpt: Decor, appliances, and gear that will make 2025 his best year yet—from Salomon sneakers to a splurge worthy Gozney pizza oven.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.The best gifts for dad should lean into what he loves most (besides you). Sure, an obvious pick like a customized mug or a gift card to his favorite shop are great ideas, but something that caters to his interests and that he’ll actually use? Prepare to solidify your status as the favorite. Gift the die-hard sports fanatics a chic piece of memorabilia (yes, those exist!) that supports his favorite team. Or if he’s most comfortable in the kitchen, a recipe journal or pizza oven could be calling his name. Is he a little too attached to his worn-out work bag? A new one is the gift he never knew he needed.We’re just a few weeks away from Father’s Day (June 15, mark your calendars!), so you have plenty of time to shop for the father figure in your life—or bookmark some ideas if you need a future birthday gift or holiday present. It has tons of compartments, too, so he can store everything he needs for work, workouts, or travel. New dads might also prefer to use this as their signature cool dad diaper bag.Salomon XT-6 Gore-Tex ShoesOutdoorsy dads are covered with this trail shoe, which is backed by hundreds of positive reviews. Designed with waterproofing and extra stability, they’ll keep him dry and comfortable on your next family hike but are also stylish enough that he’ll be the coolest-looking guy shopping at Whole Foods.The North Face Summer LT Run HatThe North Face is a go-to for great gifts your dad is guaranteed to love. Take this lightweight hat, for instance, which is made with quick-drying fabric and breathable mesh side panels that will keep him cool on his weekend jogs.Shinola Runwell Leather Messenger BagChances are, he could use a new work bag. For a more luxurious, high-quality gift, this one is crafted from premium leather, has plenty of pockets (including one for his laptop), and a subtle magnetic closure.J.Crew Sterling Silver Rectangle Cuff LinksYou don’t have to be into jewelry to appreciate some handsome cuff links peeking out of a crisp, French cuff shirt. This heirloom-worthy sterling silver pair is simple, understated, and elegant for dressing up a suit or doing the most at the office.Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed BeanieCrafted with Mongolian cashmere and built for dads who love to stay cozy, this super soft ribbed beanie is a year-round staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie).Our Legacy Cotton Coach JacketCater to your favorite fashionisto’s love of Scandi design with this timeless work jacket from Swedish–based Our Legacy. A staple that can be dressed up or down, the sturdy cotton material is cut with a slightly dropped shoulder silhouette that’ll give your guy the boxier fit he gravitates towards.KitchenGozney Tread Pizza OvenWhile your dad might not travel the world with his cookware a la Stanley Tucci, he probably loves pizza night. Skip the delivery with this ultraportable pizza oven, one of Gozney’s highly anticipated new arrivals. He can keep in the backyard or take on the go, Tucci-style. (Psst—the brand is also Benny Blanco–approved).ButcherBox Curated Classic BoxSummertime is around the corner, which means it’s time to start thinking about all the backyard BBQs drawing near. Encourage your own grill master to enjoy his favorite hobby with a regular supply of sustainably sourced meat—no trip to the butcher required. It’s so high-tech, in fact, that he can pair it with an app to track his water intake via Bluetooth.Papier Dad's Recipes JournalFor your favorite personal chef, encourage him to write down his best recipes in this keepsake journal that can easily double as coffee table decor. Add your own photo and customize the title with an inside joke or sweet reference for your most thoughtful gift to date.HobbiesUncommon Goods MLB Stadium Sculpture CandleA gift guide for dads wouldn’t be complete without a shout-out to the sports aficionados. Each engraved plate can be customized with his initials, a special message, or logo, and it’ll instantly personalize his most treasured items.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

The best gifts for dad should lean into what he loves most (besides you). Sure, an obvious pick like a customized mug or a gift card to his favorite shop are great ideas, but something that caters to his interests and that he’ll actually use? Prepare to solidify your status as the favorite. Gift the die-hard sports fanatics a chic piece of memorabilia (yes, those exist!) that supports his favorite team. Or if he’s most comfortable in the kitchen, a recipe journal or pizza oven could be calling his name. Is he a little too attached to his worn-out work bag? A new one is the gift he never knew he needed.

We’re just a few weeks away from Father’s Day (June 15, mark your calendars!), so you have plenty of time to shop for the father figure in your life—or bookmark some ideas if you need a future birthday gift or holiday present. Read on for the best-selling Father’s Day gift ideas, including in-demand and personalized picks sure to dazzle the dad in your life.

Our Top Picks for the Best Gifts for Dad:

  • For the Fashionable Hiker: Salomon XT-6 Gore-Tex Shoes, $180
  • For the Stylish Scholar: STAMTECH Custom Logo Book Embosser Stamp, $15
  • For the Sports Fan: MLB Stadium Sculpture Candle, $48
  • For the Office Warrior: Shinola Runwell Leather Messenger Bag, $895
  • For the Adventurous Grillmaster: Gozney Tread, $500

Clothing & Accessories

On Track Pack Lite Bag

Whether he’s a frequent traveler or constantly lugging his life in a bag, give him an upgrade with this On Cloud tote. It has tons of compartments, too, so he can store everything he needs for work, workouts, or travel. New dads might also prefer to use this as their signature cool dad diaper bag.

Salomon XT-6 Gore-Tex Shoes

Outdoorsy dads are covered with this trail shoe, which is backed by hundreds of positive reviews. Designed with waterproofing and extra stability, they’ll keep him dry and comfortable on your next family hike but are also stylish enough that he’ll be the coolest-looking guy shopping at Whole Foods.

The North Face Summer LT Run Hat

The North Face is a go-to for great gifts your dad is guaranteed to love. Take this lightweight hat, for instance, which is made with quick-drying fabric and breathable mesh side panels that will keep him cool on his weekend jogs.

Shinola Runwell Leather Messenger Bag

Chances are, he could use a new work bag. For a more luxurious, high-quality gift, this one is crafted from premium leather, has plenty of pockets (including one for his laptop), and a subtle magnetic closure.

J.Crew Sterling Silver Rectangle Cuff Links

You don’t have to be into jewelry to appreciate some handsome cuff links peeking out of a crisp, French cuff shirt. This heirloom-worthy sterling silver pair is simple, understated, and elegant for dressing up a suit or doing the most at the office.

Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed Beanie

Crafted with Mongolian cashmere and built for dads who love to stay cozy, this super soft ribbed beanie is a year-round staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie).

Our Legacy Cotton Coach Jacket

Cater to your favorite fashionisto’s love of Scandi design with this timeless work jacket from Swedish–based Our Legacy. A staple that can be dressed up or down, the sturdy cotton material is cut with a slightly dropped shoulder silhouette that’ll give your guy the boxier fit he gravitates towards.

Kitchen

Gozney Tread Pizza Oven

While your dad might not travel the world with his cookware a la Stanley Tucci, he probably loves pizza night. Skip the delivery with this ultraportable pizza oven, one of Gozney’s highly anticipated new arrivals. He can keep in the backyard or take on the go, Tucci-style. (Psst—the brand is also Benny Blanco–approved).

ButcherBox Curated Classic Box

Summertime is around the corner, which means it’s time to start thinking about all the backyard BBQs drawing near. Encourage your own grill master to enjoy his favorite hobby with a regular supply of sustainably sourced meat—no trip to the butcher required. And since each box is delivered within five days of billing, it makes for a solid last-minute gift idea too.

LARQ Bottle PureVis 2

Hydration is key for everyone, and this stainless-steel water bottle takes it to the next level for Dad. It’s so high-tech, in fact, that he can pair it with an app to track his water intake via Bluetooth.

Papier Dad's Recipes Journal

For your favorite personal chef, encourage him to write down his best recipes in this keepsake journal that can easily double as coffee table decor. Add your own photo and customize the title with an inside joke or sweet reference for your most thoughtful gift to date.

Hobbies

Uncommon Goods MLB Stadium Sculpture Candle

A gift guide for dads wouldn’t be complete without a shout-out to the sports aficionados. My architect husband is a die-hard New York Mets fan and a firm believer that you can never have too many candles on-hand. So it only made sense that one of his favorite Christmas gifts was this hand-poured wax candle topped with an intricately designed, laser-cut wooden replica of Citi Field. Choose dad’s favorite team, and he’ll light it all season long.

STAMTECH Custom Logo Book Embosser Stamp

With this unique gift from Amazon, he can make his mark on a ton of stuff—stationery, labels, books, recipes, and so on. Each engraved plate can be customized with his initials, a special message, or logo, and it’ll instantly personalize his most treasured items.
